net.cloud.gfx.sprites

Class SpriteCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.sprites.SpriteCollection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockSpriteCollection, SimpleSpriteCollection

    public abstract class SpriteCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of sprite images. Holds the images and provides methods to obtain them. Also provides methods to manipulate the collection. Optionally provides functionality to lock on all or part of a collection to help synchronize modifications.

    • Field Summary

      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] sprites
      Store the images as an array of BufferedImage objects

    • Field Detail

      • sprites

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] sprites
        Store the images as an array of BufferedImage objects

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteCollection

        public SpriteCollection(int size)
        Initialize a new SpriteCollection. It will be set to hold the given number of images. This capacity cannot be changed during runtime. The images will not be initialized, however. Image initialization must be done else-ways.
        Parameters:
        size - The number of sprites in the collection

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public abstract void lock(int spriteIndex)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Optional operation. Should attempt to obtain a lock on the given sprite. The lock may extend to a group of sprites, a single sprite, or all sprites. Blocks until the lock is acquired.
        Parameters:
        spriteIndex - The index of the sprite that will be modified
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the lock could not be obtained due to a thread interrupt

      • unlock

        public abstract void unlock(int spriteIndex)
        Optional operation. Release a lock that has previously been acquired via lock(int)
        Parameters:
        spriteIndex - The index of the sprite that is done being modified

      • finishLoading

        public abstract java.awt.image.BufferedImage finishLoading(SpriteLoader loader,
                                                           SpriteSet set,
                                                           int spriteID,
                                                           CachedFileRequest pendingRequest)
                                                    throws FileRequestException,
                                                           java.io.IOException
        Double dispatch method. It should simply call return loader.finishLoading(set, this, spriteID, pendingRequest);
        Parameters:
        loader - The SpriteLoader currently doing the loading work, needing some help finishing it.
        set - The SpriteSet the image is being loaded from
        spriteID - The ID of the sprite being loaded
        pendingRequest - The file request grabbing the sprite's data
        Returns:
        The requested image, once it is loaded and ready
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the FileServer could not get the image files
        FileRequestException - If the sprite file data could not be read

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite(int index)
        Obtain a sprite from this collection. The returned image may be null if it has not been loaded yet.
        Parameters:
        index - The index into the collection the sprite is at. (The ID of the sprite)
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage for the sprite, or null if it has not been loaded

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(int index)
        Check to see if a sprite has been loaded yet.
        Parameters:
        index - The index into the collection the sprite is at. (The ID of the sprite)
        Returns:
        True if the sprite has been loaded and placed into the collection

      • putSprite

        public void putSprite(int index,
                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage sprite)
        Place the given sprite into this collection at the given index. Will overwrite a current sprite.
        Parameters:
        index - The index into the collection the sprite is at. (The ID of the sprite)
        sprite - The image for the sprite

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        The number of sprites in the collection
